anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
text: A psalm of David. A song for the dedication of the House.aI.e., the Temple.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: אֲרוֹמִמְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה כִּ֣י דִלִּיתָ֑נִי וְלֹֽא־שִׂמַּ֖חְתָּ אֹיְבַ֣י לִֽי׃
text:
I extol You, O LORD,
for You have lifted me up,
and not let my enemies rejoice over me.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
text:
O LORD, my God,
I cried out to You,
and You healed me.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הֶעֱלִ֣יתָ מִן־שְׁא֣וֹל נַפְשִׁ֑י חִ֝יִּיתַ֗נִי (מיורדי) [מִיׇּֽרְדִי־]בֽוֹר׃
text:
O LORD, You brought me up from Sheol,
preserved me from going down into the Pit.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: זַמְּר֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חֲסִידָ֑יו וְ֝הוֹד֗וּ לְזֵ֣כֶר קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
text:
O you faithful of the LORD, sing to Him,
and praise His holy name.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: כִּ֤י רֶ֨גַע ׀ בְּאַפּוֹ֮ חַיִּ֢ים בִּרְצ֫וֹנ֥וֹ בָּ֭עֶרֶב יָלִ֥ין בֶּ֗כִי וְלַבֹּ֥קֶר רִנָּֽה׃
text:
For He is angry but a moment,
and when He is pleased there is life.
bOr “Weeping may linger for the night.”One may lie down weeping at nightfall;-b
but at dawn there are shouts of joy.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
text:
When I was untroubled,
I thought, “I shall never be shaken,”
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בִּרְצוֹנְךָ֮ הֶעֱמַ֢דְתָּה לְֽהַרְרִ֫י־עֹ֥ז הִסְתַּ֥רְתָּ פָנֶ֗יךָ הָיִ֥יתִי נִבְהָֽל׃
text:
for You, O LORD, when You were pleased,
made [me]cFollowing Saadia, R. Isaiah of Trani; cf. Ibn Ezra. firm as a mighty mountain.
When You hid Your face,
I was terrified.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
text:
I called to You, O LORD;
to my Lord I made appeal,
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: מַה־בֶּ֥צַע בְּדָמִי֮ בְּרִדְתִּ֢י אֶ֫ל־שָׁ֥חַת הֲיוֹדְךָ֥ עָפָ֑ר הֲיַגִּ֥יד אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
text:
“What is to be gained from my death,dLit. “blood.”
from my descent into the Pit?
Can dust praise You?
Can it declare Your faithfulness?
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
text:
Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me;
O LORD, be my help!”
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: הָפַ֣כְתָּ מִסְפְּדִי֮ לְמָח֢וֹל לִ֥֫י פִּתַּ֥חְתָּ שַׂקִּ֑י וַֽתְּאַזְּרֵ֥נִי שִׂמְחָֽה׃
text:
You turned my lament into dancing,
you undid my sackcloth and girded me with joy,
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Pesukei Dezimra, Introductory Psalm 1
he: לְמַ֤עַן ׀ יְזַמֶּרְךָ֣ כָ֭בוֹד וְלֹ֣א יִדֹּ֑ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י לְעוֹלָ֥ם אוֹדֶֽךָּ׃ {פ}
text:
that [my] whole being might sing hymns to You endlessly;
O LORD my God, I will praise You forever.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS
